intro: Tetranthera cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tetranthera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in countries like Brazil and Mexico. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are typically elliptical or lance-shaped. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on slender pedicels. Tetranthera cuneata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and along stream banks.
